question: Question_05
statement:
Full-Solution Problems. In questions 2-8, justify your answers and show
all your work. If a box is provided, write your final answer there.
Simplification of answers is not required unless explicitly requested.

Cobblestone Engineering has been contracted to build a bridge and a
pathway from Calculus City located at point A on the shoreline of a 6km
wide river that runs west to east, to a power plant at point B on the
opposite shoreline, 8km to the east. It costs 40 dollars per km to build
a bridge over the river and 20 dollars per km to build a pathway along a
shoreline. How should the company proceed in order to minimize the total
cost? Be sure to justify that the total cost is indeed a minimum.
sols:
According to the picture,

\begin{figure}[htbp]
\centering
\includegraphics[width=.5\textwidth]{BridgeMath101Dec2010.jpg}
\caption{BridgeMath101Dec2010.jpg}
\end{figure}

Thus, the cost equation is

$\displaystyle C = 40d + 20(8-x)$

To get this in terms of one variable, note by the Pythagorean theorem,
we have

$\displaystyle d^{2} = 6^{2} + x^{2}$

Hence, we have

$\displaystyle C = 40\sqrt{36+x^{2}} + 20(8-x)$

Differentiating yields

\begin{align*}
C' &= \frac{40(2x)}{2\sqrt{36+x^{2}}} -20\\
&= \frac{40x - 20\sqrt{36+x^{2}}}{\sqrt{36 + x^{2}}}\end{align*}

Setting the derivative to 0 yields

\begin{align*}
0 &= \frac{40x - 20\sqrt{36+x^{2}}}{\sqrt{36 + x^{2}}}\\
0 &= 40x - 20\sqrt{36+x^{2}} \\
\sqrt{36+x^{2}} &= 2x  \\
36+x^{2} &= 4x^{2}  \\
36 &= 3x^{2}  \\
12 &= x^{2}  \\
\pm 2\sqrt{3} &= x  \end{align*}

Notice that the negative answer is inadmissable since it corresponds to
a side length (and \emph{x} should be positive to minimize cost). Now,
the endpoints are \emph{x} = 0 and \emph{x} = 8. Then,

$\displaystyle C(0) = 40\sqrt{36+0^{2}} + 20(8-0) = 240 + 160 = 400$

\begin{align*}
C(2\sqrt{3}) &= 40\sqrt{36+(2\sqrt{3})^{2}} + 20(8-2\sqrt{3}) \\
&= 40\sqrt{36 + 12} + 160 - 40\sqrt{3} \\
&= 160\sqrt{3} + 160 - 40\sqrt{3} \\
&= 120\sqrt{3} + 160 < 400 \end{align*}

$\displaystyle C(8) = 40\sqrt{36+8^{2}} + 20(8-8) = 40\sqrt{100} = 400$

and so the minimum occurs at $\displaystyle x = 2\sqrt{3}$
hints:
Try to draw a picture first of the situation. Draw a line from point A
intersecting the opposite shore line at a point P. Call this distance
\emph{d} and call the distance from the opposite site of A to P the
value \emph{x}.
Write an equation for the total cost, then get it down to one variable.
